long: Meaning: properly, "the hind part"; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, "after" (in various senses).  Usage: after (that, -ward), again, at, away from, back (from, -side), behind, beside, by, follow (after, -ing), forasmuch, from, hereafter, hinder end, + out (over) live, + persecute, posterity, pursuing, remnant, seeing, since, thence(-forth), when, with.  Source: from "H309";
